review:
Redmi note 4 is the best budget phone ever. It offers very good specifications
with this price range. I am very happy with the it's performance Qualcomm
Snapdragon 625 chipset and Octa-core 2.0 GHz Cortex-A53 CPU 4GB ram 64GB
internal memory. Multi tasking handle very smoothly. The display is good
crispy colour sunlight eligibility is quite good viewing angles of display
okay. Camera is good but not as expected. Fingerprint recognize very speed.
Battery life is awesome non removable Li-Po 4100 mAh battery. I am impressed
with that.  
  
Overall xiaomi done a great mobile on this price segment.  
  
4/5 i am giving Four stars for this mobile out of 5 stars.  
  
Thank You.

It's not that amazing how I always heard about it. Camera is not that gud I
mean clarity. Rest I would not recommend to buy this phone, instead go for
Moto z.

Cosmetic look of the Mobile was excellent, that's why, initially I gave 5 star
rating. However, facing great difficulty in both outgoing and incoming calls.
Nobody is able to hear my call nor am I able to hear the incoming calls. Plz
replace ths Mobile Redmi Note 4 Black by a similar Model immediately latest
within a week. If delayed, I shall be bound to order return of the product.

As always, Amazon Delivery Is Excellent.  
Product: A little bit of doubt regarding the product Received. Packaging is
different as compared to what I received from Flipkart. Adapted is different.
Adapter cable is quite short in length as compared to what came with Flipkart
delivery. Product packaging is of Sep'17. In all creates a doubt about genuine
product delivery. However the Mobile is as normal.

review:
==========================  
MY VERDICT ON REDMI NOTE 4  
==========================  
I bought RN4 recently and some months have passed since I've bought this
phone, so I'm gonna give you an honest review of my actual experience with
this phone.  
  
=========  
SD Specs:  
=========  
◆ Android OS: Nougat 7.0  
◆ MIUI Version: MIUI Global 9.2 | Stable (Latest)  
◆ CPU: Octa-core Max 2.0GHz  
◆ RAM: 4GB  
◆ Internal Storage: 64GB (near about 55GB Available, EXP 128GB)  
◆ Camera: 13MP/5MP - Auto (Medium), Flash (Low), HDR Mode (High Quality)  
◆ Battery life: Games "Ultra" (8h:10h), Browsing 3G (10h:12h), Idle (+3 days)  
  
=====  
PROS:  
=====  
1\. Run all games on the highest settings. (minor heating in graphic consuming
games)  
2\. Almost no overheating at all. (unless you've opened an app and left the
screen on without sleep for a long time)  
3\. Best screen resolution and videos on 1080p are AWESOME. (can run 60fps
videos as well)  
4\. Massive storage which can hold an insane amount of apps.  
5\. Frequent updates for MIUI which fix bugs and improve performance and
appearance.  
6\. Different supported official ROMS where you can enjoy Android Oreo and its
features before release.  
7\. The metallic frame which makes the phone more solid and overall, the phone
is comfortable in your hands.  
  
======  
CONS:  
======  
1\. Relatively bad camera. (duo to RN4's high screen resolution, you'll feel
that all picture taken from it are unclear as if you're watching 480p video on
HD Screen but they're great if you open them on other phones)  
-Bugs!!! RN4 System and MIUI Apps aren't perfect so they frequently give us updates to fix these issues but still they're annoying when they occur. (still, they aren't serious)  
2\. Purchasing a Glass Screen and a Phone Case is a must. (RN4 doesn't have
Gorilla Glass or full metal frame so it'd be better if you buy those)  
  
If someone is looking for a budget range phone, then this is device you should
look for, or if you can spend a 2k more then MI A1 is the best.  
I hope I was helpful to you. Thankyou.
